Title: Relates to claims against insurers for petroleum spills
Summary: Relates to claims against insurers for petroleum spills, providing that all direct and indirect damages relating to a discharge of petroleum shall be considered insurable property damage, creating an affirmative defense for insurers that the insured failed to take reasonable steps to prevent such discharge and requiring insurers provide a notice in every homeowner's policy that the insured is responsible to take reasonable steps to prevent petroleum discharges.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the navigation law, in relation to claims against insurers for petroleum spills
